page.title: 03FRUIT GROWING (CONT)
page.content: The apple trees are between 4-5 metres in height, although 2 orchards have much smaller trees(2.5m) but at a rate of 1000 per ha. There seems to be a trend towards smaller trees - perhaps because of easier harvesting. The farmer surveyed said that modern fruit farming is very expensive. Planting an orchard could cost over Â£5000 per ha. and is a highly skilled business. The farmer has to choose the ideal site, the right varieties of fruit, the correct time for planting and the pollinators. Following this come skilled operations such as planting, spraying and fertilising. One recent change is the cutting down of orchards due to overseas competition. French Golden Delicious can be produced more cheaply, so many local farmers cannot afford to maintain their orchards.
